page.title: 03AMBLE
page.content: {Amble}is situated on the{Northumbrian {coast}on the south side of the{estuary of the{River Coquet. The town}is south east of{Warkworth}village, eight miles from Alnwick and thirty from the city of{Newcastle.}Although{bronze age {burial remains}have been found in the vicinity, the{present settlement}grew up after the{river changed its course in{1764}and an{Act of Parliament of{1837}gave permission to build a {harbour}for the{shipment of coal}from the{mines}at{Radcliffe and Broomhill. The{population}developed from under {200}in{1820}to{2,975}by{the end of the {century.}In{1885 300,000 tons of mined {coal}was being{shipped from Amble}in {800 steamers and sailing ships.}Now the{mines are closed,}being replaced by{open-cast mining. Fishing}remains an important industry, but the{un- {employment}rate in{1985}is quite high.
